intro: Sanicula stapfiana, commonly known as the Stapf's sanicle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive fern-like appearance and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
